ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and the witness and the witnessed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And the witness and the witnessed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and by the witness and what is witnessed:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and by the witness (Muhammad) and that which is witnessed (the Day of Judgment),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And by oath of the day that is a witness and by oath of a day in which the people present themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And by the Witness and by the Witnessed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the bearer of witness and those against whom the witness is borne.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: by the witness and the witnessed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And by the witness and that whereunto he beareth testimony,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: by the Witness and the witnessed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And by the Day witnessing and the Day witnessed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: by the Witness and the Witnessed:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: By one that witnesses, and the subject of the witness;-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And by the witnessing day (i.e. Friday), and by the witnessed day [i.e. the day of 'Arafat (Hajj) the ninth of Dhul-Hijjah];
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: By the witness and the witnessed!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And by the witness and the witnessed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [by] the witness and what is witnessed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [85:3] and [by] the witness, Friday, and the witnessed, the day of ‘Arafa — that is how these three [elements] have been explained in hadīth: for the first one is ‘promised’, the second one is ‘a witness’ [that testifies] to deeds performed in it, while the third is ‘witnessed’ by mankind and angels (the introductory [particle] of the response to the oath has been omitted, but is implied to be laqad, ‘verily’, [sc. laqad qutila ashābu’lukhdūd]):
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And by the witness) the day of Friday (and that whereunto he beareth testimony) the day of 'Arafah and it is said it is the day of immolation; it is also said that 'the witness' refers to the children of Adam while 'that whereunto he bears testimony' refers to the Day of Judgement; and it is also said that 'the witness' is Muhammad (pbuh) while 'that whereunto he bears testimony' is his community; Allah swore by all these things that His chastisement of those who disbelieve in Him is very severe, 744
